t: Ezekiel 28
Proclamation Against the King of Tyre
The*p word of the Lord*s came to me again, saying,

“Son of man, say to the prince of Tyre, ‘Thus says the Lord God:*s “Because*pn your heart is*i lifted up, And*ld you say, ‘I am*i a god, I*ld sit in*i the seat of gods, In*ld the midst of the seas,’ Yet*ld you are*i a man, and not a god, Though*ld you set your heart as the heart of a god
(Behold,*ld you are*i wiser than Daniel! There*ld is no secret that can be hidden from you!
With*ld your wisdom and your understanding You*ld have gained riches for yourself, And*ld gathered gold and silver into your treasuries;
By*ld your great wisdom in trade you have increased your riches, And*ld your heart is lifted up because of your riches),”
‘Therefore*p thus says the Lord God:*s “Because*pn you have set your heart as the heart of a god,
Behold,*ld therefore, I will bring strangers against you, The*ld most terrible of the nations; And*ld they shall draw their swords against the beauty of your wisdom, And*ld defile your splendor.
They*ld shall throw you down into the Pit, And*ld you shall die the death of the slain In*ld the midst of the seas.
“Will*ln you still say before him who slays you, ‘I*ld am*i a god’? But*ld you shall*i be*i a man, and not a god, In*ld the hand of him who slays you.
You*ld shall die the death of the uncircumcised By*ld the hand of aliens; For*ld I have spoken,” says the Lord God.’”*s
Lamentation for the King of Tyre
Moreover*p the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying,
“Son of man, take up a lamentation for the king of Tyre, and say to him, ‘Thus says the Lord God:*s “You*pn were*i the seal of perfection, Full*ld of wisdom and perfect in beauty.

You*ld were in Eden, the garden of God; Every*ld precious stone was*i your covering: The*ld sardius, topaz, and diamond, Beryl,*ld onyx, and jasper, Sapphire,*ld turquoise, and emerald with gold. The*ld workmanship of your timbrels and pipes Was*ld prepared for you on the day you were created.
“You*ln were*i the anointed cherub who covers; I*ld established you; You*ld were on the holy mountain of God; You*ld walked back and forth in the midst of fiery stones.
You*ld were*i perfect in your ways from the day you were created, Till*ld iniquity was found in you.

“By*ln the abundance of your trading You*ld became filled with violence within, And*ld you sinned; Therefore*ld I cast you as a profane thing Out*ld of the mountain of God; And*ld I destroyed you, O covering cherub, From*ld the midst of the fiery stones.

“Your*ln heart was lifted up because of your beauty; You*ld corrupted your wisdom for the sake of your splendor; I*ld cast you to the ground, I*ld laid you before kings, That*ld they might gaze at you.

“You*ln defiled your sanctuaries By*ld the multitude of your iniquities, By*ld the iniquity of your trading; Therefore*ld I brought fire from your midst; It*ld devoured you, And*ld I turned you to ashes upon the earth In*ld the sight of all who saw you.
All*ld who knew you among the peoples are astonished at you; You*ld have become a horror, And*ld shall*i be*i no more forever.”’”
Proclamation Against Sidon
Then*p the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying,
“Son of man, set your face toward Sidon, and prophesy against her,

and say, ‘Thus says the Lord God:*s “Behold,*pn I am*i against you, O Sidon; I*ld will be glorified in your midst; And*ld they shall know that I am*i the Lord,*s When*ld I execute judgments in her and am hallowed in her.

For*ld I will send pestilence upon her, And*ld blood in her streets; The*ld wounded shall be judged in her midst By*ld the sword against her on every side; Then*ld they shall know that I am*i the Lord.*s
“And*p there shall no longer be a pricking brier or a painful thorn for the house of Israel from among all who*i are*i around them, who despise them. Then they shall know that I am*i the Lord God.”*s
Israel’s Future Blessing

‘Thus*p says the Lord God:*s “When I have gathered the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered, and am hallowed in them in the sight of the Gentiles, then they will dwell in their own land which I gave to My servant Jacob.

And they will dwell safely there, build houses, and plant vineyards; yes, they will dwell securely, when I execute judgments on all those around them who despise them. Then they shall know that I am*i the Lord*s their God.”’”
